articles.author: Spencer Kimball
articles.title: Cocoa prices surge to all-time highs as bad weather hurts West Africa crop yield - CNBC
articles.description: The El Nino weather pattern is causing drier temperatures in West Africa, where three-quarters of the world's cocoa is produced.
articles.content:
Cocoa prices have surged to all-time highs this week as bad weather conditions hammer crop yields in West Africa, home to three quarters of the world's production.
